altTitles.ja: ファイアーエムブレム ザ・コンプリート

description.en:
Fire Emblem The Complete (ファイアーエムブレム ザ・コンプリート) is an artbook providing artworks and information of characters from Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light, Fire Emblem Gaiden, and Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem.  
  
While the main artist(s) of the character portraits went uncredited, there are four artists who illustrated the comics inside The Complete: Yumi Tamura, Katsuya Terada, Keinojou Mizutama, and Nasu Yukie.

biography.en:
Yumi Tamura is a Japanese manga artist. Her debut short story, Ore-tachi no Zettai Jikan ("This is the Time for Us"), was published in 1983 in Bessatsu Shoujo Comic and received the 1983 Shogakukan Grand Prize for new artists.

She made her reputation with the long-running shoujo action/adventure series Basara, for which she won the 1993 Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga. Her latest series, 7SEEDS, for which she won a second Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga in 2003.
biography.es-la:
Yumi Tamura es una artista de manga japonesa. Su primera historia corta, Ore-tachi no Zettai Jikan ("Este es el momento para nosotros"), se publicó en 1983 en Bessatsu Shoujo Comic y recibió el Gran Premio Shogakukan de 1983 para nuevos artistas.

Se dio a conocer con la serie de acción/aventura shoujo Basara, de larga duración, por la que ganó el Premio Shogakukan de manga en 1993. Su última serie, 7SEEDS, por la que ganó un segundo premio Shogakukan de manga shoujo en 2003.

biography.en:
**Name** (in native language)
寺田克也
**Birth Date**
December 7, 1963
**Birth Place**
Tamano (Okayama Prefecture), Japan

---
From Wikipedia:
Katsuya Terada is probably best known in the United States as the character-designer for the animated film Blood: The Last Vampire. He has also done work related to American comics, such as Iron Man and Hellboy (one of his illustrations was used for an official statuette of Hellboy). He also made additional contributions to old issues of Nintendo Power. In Japan, he is probably best known for the Tantei Jingūji Saburō mystery-adventure video game series.

Terada has defined himself as a "rakugaki" artist, more of a philosophy than a style of drawing, in which one draws a little everywhere, all the time, without thinking too much, on notebooks etc. He is a very prolific artist; one of his collections of sketches numbers more than 1000 pages, appropriately called Rakuga King.

He has done very little group-drawn work (an exception being the manga Saiyukiden Daienou (Monkey King)), his principal activities being illustration and character design.

His use of CG tools is integrated very well in his illustrations, giving his work a vivid and rich appearance. Most distinctive, though, are the female faces in his work, which could be described as “cute”, but with a dangerous or elusive character to the eyes. He has admitted various influences on his work, particularly European ones, like Jean Giraud (a.k.a. Moebius) and the magazine Métal Hurlant which he has said gave him a taste for strong women who are slightly stripped.
Won the Seiun Award for Best Artist in 2002.

Yumi Tamura is a Japanese manga artist. Her debut short story, Ore-tachi no Zettai Jikan ("This is the Time for Us"), was published in 1983 in Bessatsu Shoujo Comic and received the 1983 Shogakukan Grand Prize for new artists.

She made her reputation with the long-running shoujo action/adventure series Basara, for which she won the 1993 Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga. Her latest series, 7SEEDS, for which she won a second Shogakukan Manga Award for shoujo manga in 2003.
biography.es-la:
Yumi Tamura es una artista de manga japonesa. Su primera historia corta, Ore-tachi no Zettai Jikan ("Este es el momento para nosotros"), se publicó en 1983 en Bessatsu Shoujo Comic y recibió el Gran Premio Shogakukan de 1983 para nuevos artistas.

Se dio a conocer con la serie de acción/aventura shoujo Basara, de larga duración, por la que ganó el Premio Shogakukan de manga en 1993. Su última serie, 7SEEDS, por la que ganó un segundo premio Shogakukan de manga shoujo en 2003.

**Name** (in native language)

**Birth Date**

**Birth Place**
Tamano (Okayama Prefecture), Japan
